Posted By: Arachibutyrophobia (7/25/2009 5:40:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A few years ago, when Kamigawa was out, I was excited to open a pack of the new expansion, Saviors. The commons were decent, and the uncommons were not horrible, but then I laid eyes on the rare. *One With Nothing*, i thought, *well, that's an interesting name, and it's black for only one swamp! Let's see what it does!* I read the text, and read it again. *Are you kidding me?* I thought. "Discard your hand." I sat there for ten minutes, grasping at straws for reasons why Wizards could have possibly printed this card. I came up short.  
It's not even that this shouldn't be a rare, it simply shouldn't be a card! Yeah, you could say it would work in a madness or treshold deck for either turn one cheap spells or turn one threshold. Great. Turn two rolls around and you draw either a) a land, which you play then p\*\*\*, or b) a useful nonland card which you can't even play because all you have is a swamp! I was so sad. 0.5/5
posts.html:
A few years ago, when Kamigawa was out, I was excited to open a pack of the new expansion, Saviors. The commons were decent, and the uncommons were not horrible, but then I laid eyes on the rare. One With Nothing, i thought, well, that's an interesting name, and it's black for only one swamp! Let's see what it does! I read the text, and read it again. Are you kidding me? I thought. "Discard your hand." I sat there for ten minutes, grasping at straws for reasons why Wizards could have possibly printed this card. I came up short.
It's not even that this shouldn't be a rare, it simply shouldn't be a card! Yeah, you could say it would work in a madness or treshold deck for either turn one cheap spells or turn one threshold. Great. Turn two rolls around and you draw either a) a land, which you play then p***, or b) a useful nonland card which you can't even play because all you have is a swamp! I was so sad. 0.5/5
